law.catch_line: In selecting applicants for venture firm certification, the Authority shall consider:...

section.section: An applicant shall file an application with the Department in the form required by the Department.
The application shall include the applicant's most recent financial statements.
The Department shall begin accepting applications for certification on or before January 1, 2012.
An application for certification may not be accepted after May 1, 2012.

text.section:
To be certified as a venture firm:
the applicant must have, at the time of application, an equity capitalization, net assets, or written commitments of at least $500,000 in the form of cash or cash equivalents; and
at least two principals or persons employed to direct the investment of the designated capital of the applicant must have at least 5 years of money management experience in the venture capital or private equity sectors

Not later than 90 days after an application is filed, the Secretary shall either:
issue the certification; or
refuse to issue the certification and communicate in detail to the applicant the grounds for the refusal.
